Group.title: Documentation to Support DISA OS SRG Mapping
Group.description: These groups exist to document how the Red Hat Enterprise Linux product meets (or does not meet) requirements listed in the DISA OS SRG, for those cases where Groups or Rules elsewhere in scap-security-guide do not clearly relate.

Rule.title: Product Meets this Requirement
Rule.rationale: Red Hat Enterprise Linux meets this requirement by design.
Rule.ocil: RHEL6 supports this requirement and cannot be configured to be out of compliance. This is a permanent not a finding.
Rule.description: This requirement is permanent not a finding. No fix is required.

Rule.title: Guidance Does Not Meet this Requirement Due to Impracticality or Scope
Rule.rationale: The guidance does not meet this requirement. The requirement is impractical or out of scope.
Rule.ocil: RHEL6 cannot support this requirement without assistance from an external application, policy, or service. This requirement is NA.
Rule.description: This requirement is NA. No fix is required.

Rule.title: Product Does Not Meet this Requirement Due to Impracticality or Scope
Rule.rationale: The product does not meet this requirement. The requirement is impractical or out of scope.
Rule.ocil: RHEL6 cannot support this requirement without assistance from an external application or server. This requirement is NA.
Rule.description: This requirement is NA. No fix is required.

Rule.title: Implementation of the Requirement is Unclear
Rule.rationale: It is unclear how to satisfy this requirement.
Rule.ocil: RHEL6 does not support this requirement. This is a permanent finding.
Rule.description: This requirement is a permanent finding and cannot be fixed. An appropriate mitigation for the system must be implemented but this finding cannot be considered fixed.

Rule.title: A New Policy/Manual Rule is Needed
Rule.rationale: A new Rule needs to be created in the scap-security-guide content.
Rule.ocil: RHEL6 does support this requirement but the guidance is not yet written.
Rule.description: When the guidance is written, the fix will be forthcoming.
